episodes.description: Yamagata's Tobishima Island in the Sea of Japan features flocks of birds resting their wings or raising their young while peregrine falcons hunt from the cliffs above to feed their nesting chicks.
episodes.title: Four Seasons in Japan

episodes.description: Chiba's Isumi Seashore on the Boso Peninsula features a lagoon with tidal mudflat crabs and feasting birds, breeding grounds for the endangered little tern, and crucial habitat for rare beach plants.
episodes.title: Four Seasons in Japan

episodes.description: This episode of Four Seasons in Japan introduces the Ome Hills, west of Tokyo. In spring and summer, the woods and valleys teem with birds, spring cicadas, salamanders, beetles, and butterflies.
episodes.title: Four Seasons in Japan

episodes.description: This episode of Four Seasons in Japan introduces Shosenkyo Gorge in Kofu Basin, Yamanashi. As winter approaches, dippers, wagtails, tits, and other birds feast on the bounty of the forest and river.
episodes.title: Four Seasons in Japan

episodes.description: This episode of Four Seasons in Japan introduces the Myoko Highlands in Niigata. In winter, heavy snows cover the forested plateau, but Japanese hares and macaque monkeys persevere against the cold.
episodes.title: Four Seasons in Japan

episodes.description: Shodoshima Island, in Japan's Setonaikai Sea, is the site of rocky Kankakei Gorge, surrounded by forest. Home to ospreys, monkeys, and other wildlife, it provides a rich and fascinating habitat.
episodes.title: Four Seasons in Japan

episodes.description: The forest of Shigetomi shore in west Japan features camphor trees planted more than 50 years ago. With a rich variety of flora and fauna, it now offers a natural refuge for many insects and birds.
episodes.title: Four Seasons in Japan

episodes.description: Surrounded by coral reefs, Chibishi in Okinawa offers thousands of terns and other birds an ideal breeding ground. They coexist with hermit crabs and other creatures in an island paradise.
episodes.title: Four Seasons in Japan
